Detailed Description

Display settings for rendering the media-data in the media player and media recorder.
See also:
MediaPlayer

MediaRecorder

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DisplaySettings::ScaleType
 

This enum is used in order to determine how the actual image/video is scaled and placed within the video output window (see the parameters in the constructor).

Enumerator:
DownscaleToBounds  If the captured/playing video size is smaller than the bounds (video output window), the video is not scaled at all and is displayed centered within the bounds. If the video is larger than the bounds, the video is downscaled until the whole video content is visible within the bounds.
ScaleToBounds  If the video size is smaller than the bounds, the image is upscaled until the maximum size has been reached at which the whole video content is visible within the bounds. If upscaling is not supported, than the video shall be displayed centered in the original size. If the video is larger than the bounds, the video is downscaled until the whole image is visible within the bounds.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DisplaySettings::DisplaySettings (   )

DisplaySettings::DisplaySettings (  const Rect &  bounds,
ScaleType  scale_type,
UINT8  display_index = 0,
BOOLEAN  keep_aspect_ratio = TRUE,
BOOLEAN  is_first_frame_rendered = FALSE
) 
 

Constructor.

Parameters:
bounds The absolute position and dimensions (in pixels) of the region (window) on the display that is used for video output (playback/viewfinder). It is relative to the upper left hand corner of the (physical) display.
scale_type Scale type determines how the image content fits into the bounds (video output region).
display_idx Display index of the display used for video output (playback/viewfinder). The default value corresponds to the main display.
keep_aspect_ratio it determines if the aspect ratio (between x and y coordinates) shall be kept
is_first_frame_rendered
